DataElement.preferredName: Hospital Specific Other Therapeutic Procedure Number Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Identifies other treatment given at this facility that cannot be defined as surgery, radiation, or systemic therapy according to the defined data items in this manual.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Other treatment given at this facility that cannot be defined as surgery, radiation, or systemic therapy according to the defined data items in this manual.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An institution that provides medical, surgical, or psychiatric care and treatment for the sick or the injured.:Specified; clearly and explicitly stated.

Concepts.definition: An institution that provides medical, surgical, or psychiatric care and treatment for the sick or the injured.

Property.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned. (NCI)_An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process._Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Recommended, unknown if administered; other treatment was recommended, but it is unknown whether it was administered.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Recommended, unknown if administered; other treatment was recommended, but it is unknown whether it was administered.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Recommended, unknown if administered; other treatment was recommended, but it is unknown whether it was administered.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Refusal; other treatment was not administered. Treatment listed in code 1, 2 or 3 was recommended by the patient"s physician but was refused by the patient or the patient"s family or guardian. The refusal was noted in the patient record.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Refusal; other treatment was not administered. Treatment listed in code 1, 2 or 3 was recommended by the patient"s physician but was refused by the patient or the patient"s family or guardian. The refusal was noted in the patient record.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Refusal; other treatment was not administered. Treatment listed in code 1, 2 or 3 was recommended by the patient"s physician but was refused by the patient or the patient"s family or guardian. The refusal was noted in the patient record.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: It is unknown whether other treatment was recommended or administered because it is not stated in the patient record. Death certificate only case.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: It is unknown whether other treatment was recommended or administered because it is not stated in the patient record. Death certificate only case.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: It is unknown whether other treatment was recommended or administered because it is not stated in the patient record. Death certificate only case.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Other unproven; Cancer treatments administered by nonmedical personnel.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Other unproven; Cancer treatments administered by nonmedical personnel.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Other unproven; Cancer treatments administered by nonmedical personnel.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Patient is involved in a double-blind clinical trial. Code the treatment actually administered when the double-blind trial code is broken.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Patient is involved in a double-blind clinical trial. Code the treatment actually administered when the double-blind trial code is broken.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Patient is involved in a double-blind clinical trial. Code the treatment actually administered when the double-blind trial code is broken.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cancer treatment that cannot be assigned to specified treatment data items.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cancer treatment that cannot be assigned to specified treatment data items.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cancer treatment that cannot be assigned to specified treatment data items.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: None; all cancer treatment was coded in other treatment fields. Patient received no cancer treatment. Diagnosed at autopsy.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: None; all cancer treatment was coded in other treatment fields. Patient received no cancer treatment. Diagnosed at autopsy.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: None; all cancer treatment was coded in other treatment fields. Patient received no cancer treatment. Diagnosed at autopsy.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Other-Experimental; this code is not defined. It may be used to record participation in institution-based clinical trials.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Other-Experimental; this code is not defined. It may be used to record participation in institution-based clinical trials.
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Other-Experimental; this code is not defined. It may be used to record participation in institution-based clinical trials.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual entities required by NCI operations and systems. Includes administrative, financial, organizational and quasi-scientific concepts required for NCI operations and systems.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueDomain.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 10/03/2011 - tc - Updated VMs as per V12

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Division of Cancer Control and Population Sciences

ReferenceDocuments.name: RX Hosp--Other
ReferenceDocuments.description: Treatment for reportable hematopoietic diseases can be supportive care, observation, or any treatment that does not meet the usual definition in which treatment modifies, controls, removes, or destroys proliferating cancer tissue. Such treatments include phlebotomy, transfusions, and aspirin.

ReferenceDocuments.name: NAACCR 12.1, Data Stds/Dict.
ReferenceDocuments.description: For additional details see NAACCR, Standards for Cancer Registries Volume II, Version 12.1 Data Standards and Data Dictionary (6/2010)

ReferenceDocuments.description: For additional details see NAACCR, Standards for Cancer Registries Volume II, Version 16 Data Standards and Data Dictionary (01/2016)
